content: polka-dot hat you can sell items made from this pattern in a small capacity you can share this pattern as long as you link it to its ravelry page do not reproduce or copy if you see any incoherence in this pattern you can message me on ravelry https //www ravelry com/people/laura-m44 when reading keep in mind that english is not my first language have fun https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/polka-dot-hat-6 1 preambule this polka-dot hat is knit in the round using circular or double pointed needles the construction is simple it makes it easy to knit even if you are not used to work with 2 colors colors - color 1 is main body color c1 - color 2 is ribs and dots color c2 you can make the pompom in any color you like or you have left yarn you can use any bulky/chunky weight wool yarn of your liking - 75 85 90 meters / 82 93 98 5 yards in c1 - 80 84 88 meters / 88 92 96 yards in c2 - optional 20-40 for the pompom depending on the size you want it to be needles - 4 5mm us 7 / 40cm 16 circular needles for the ribs - 5mm us 8 / 40 cm 16 circular needles for the body you can use longer needles with magic loop method or double pointed needles other material tapestry needle for weaving in ends one stitch marker for marking start of round scissors gauge 19 stitches / 24 row = 10x10cm / 4x4 inches in stockinette stitch on larger needles sizes teen adult medium adult large in pattern it will be written as s m l finished size is about 50 56 62 cm / 19 7 22 24 5 inches in circumference 17 5 18 5 19 5 cm / 7 7 3 7 6 inches in length abbreviations - st s stitch es - ktbl knit through back loop - co cast on - k2tog knit 2 stitches together - k knit - kxc1 knit x stitches in color 1 - p purl - kxc2 knit x stitches in color 2 - kfb knit front back knit front then back loop of the same stitch to make one 2 let s go cast on using smaller needles and twisted german cast on method cast on 60 68 76 sts the twisted german cast on is very stretchy it avoids having a mark on your forehead after wearing the hat you can find a tutorial here https //www youtube com/watch v=owhrfvu5im0 however if you are not comfortable with it you can use any other cast on you like join for working in the round placing a marker to indicate the start of the round be careful not to twist your stitches on the first round ribbing with smaller needles and c2 r1 *k1tbl p1* all around repeat for 10 row length is about 4 5 cm / 1 8 inches knitting through back loop
